result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaliyah T Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED - Huber with standard release conditions, release for work, work search and treatment
IF REVOKED 2 days sentence credit

miscConds.notes:
*Bail previously posted applied to DNA surcharge and court costs. Balance of court costs to be paid as a condition of probation
*If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment. 
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

*AODA  Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
*Absolute Sobriety, random UA's
*No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
*No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
*Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate
*Parenting program if deemed appropriate

timeConds.notes: CONDITION TIME - STAYED - With Huber - to be used at agent's discretion

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaliyah T Simmons

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Herbers advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

2:53 PM Defendant Aaliyah T Simmons in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Aaliyah T Simmons.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #2. Court conducts colloquy and finds the Defendant guilty of count #2 with repeater struck. Count #1 is dismissed and read-in. 

State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:

COUNT#1:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
60 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS/RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH AND TREATMENT.  (Credit - 2 days).  

Term of Probation: 1 YEAR **TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
Parenting program if deemed appropriate. 

COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00;
Drug Offender diversion surcharge (DRGOD): $10.00;
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Cash bail posted to be applied, balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 20 days, Huber, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

File not called on the record.
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo. appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court.   
Defendant Aaliyah T Simmons did not appear.    
Attorney appeared by authorization.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

File not called on the record.
Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court.   Defendant Aaliyah T Simmons did not appear.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Herbers appeared by authorization and requests another date. Atty Herbers states he has received discovery and just received an offer in court.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Andy Herbers
Hearing on May 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

APPLY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT.  DEFENDANT PREVIOUSLY POSTED $395.00.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with Witness A/Witness B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to have no contact with any Walmart.  Defendant is not to discuss the case with the co-defendant (Le Yanna L. Shackles) listed in the Criminal Complaint.

09:34 AM Defendant Aaliyah T Simmons in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
